result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Orr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher M Orr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher M Orr was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Christopher M Orr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Christopher M Orr was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Consec to any other sentence currently serving.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Each ct concur & consec to any other sentence.
9/16/20: Court orders 2 years probation instead of 3 years on all counts.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.

Not use or possess alcohol.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DR or be in visual contact of her, her parents or her brother or their residences or places of work.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward person or property.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.
